Html: Would you allow your Irony code to be used within the StyleCop project which is under the MS-PL licence?

Sure, why not - Irony is under MIT license, do whatever you want.

Two questions: 

1. Are you planning it for c# parser or some other language? I've seen requests on Stylecop page to make it for JavaScript...

2. We are using it here, at my daytime job (inside MS in fact). We have trouble - it crashes on parameters with default values, and gives up on entire project. So we can't use it on half of our projects. When the fix will be available?

thanks

Roman

>Sure, why not - Irony is under MIT license, do whatever you want.

Actually I am considering Irony for a VB.NET and / or TSQL parser.

I am not yet on the StyleCop "team", but being bi-lingual C#/VB.NET and very appreciative of StyleCop, I am investigating writing/finding a VB.NET parser for styleCop.

>We have trouble - it crashes on parameters with default values, and gives up on entire project.

Are you able to post some sample code that illustrates this problem without disclosing any propriatry information? I would be glad to attempt to reproduce your problem and vote on it to be fixed.
